p: Over the past decades, different types of molecular markers have become available for the development of molecular genetic maps and for the selection of the most favorable allele(s) [ 122]. However, the advent of next-generation sequencing technologies (NGS) along with powerful computational pipelines has enabled the development of more informative large-scale molecular markers, which allow faster and cheaper genotyping that revolutionized plant breeding [ 121, 122, 123].
